#Text=1. Introduction
#Text=In the present decade , one of the most discussed issues is that of tackling and mitigating society ’s negative impact both on human health and the environment .
#Text=Although there is still great debate on the actual size of the human contribution to the problem , cutting down emissions is surely a positive step .
#Text=Society pollutes and harms the environment through various ways , such as unhealthy emissions such as sulfur , mainly through SO2 , NOx and greenhouse gases ( GHGs ) .
#Text=The maritime industry is part of the transportation sector , which is responsible for 14 % of the global GHGs , making it the fourth biggest sector in emissions globally .

#Text=Although ships are thought to be some of the biggest polluters , the maritime transport of goods is a relatively clean form of transportation , per kilogram of material , and is therefore given an increasing weight over air and road trade and transport .
#Text=In European coastal areas , shipping emissions contribute 1 – 7 % of ambient air PM10 levels , 1 – 14 % of PM2.5 , and at least 11 % of PM1 .
#Text=Contributions from shipping to ambient NO2 levels range between 7 – 24 % , with the highest values being recorded in the Netherlands and Denmark .
#Text=Maritime produced SOx and NOx create significant problems that will be further explained below .

#Text=Taking into account the huge and constantly growing sector of worldwide trade and transportation , it becomes clear that even the cleanest means of transport per kg of material/good has devastating effects on our health and the environment .
#Text=The many sources of air pollution caused from the maritime industry can be seen in
#Text=Figure 1
#Text=.
#Text=Reducing transportation and trade cannot be considered a realistic solution , as it is critical for international growth .
#Text=Therefore , making the maritime industry more efficient and environmentally friendly is unavoidable .
#Text=The idea of reducing the negative environmental impact is present in every economic sector , making it the ideal time to implement that in maritime as well .
#Text=Previously taken steps toward this direction were mostly indirect , through technologies primarily targeting the improvement of the vessel ’s engine efficiency .
#Text=However , green technologies and renewable energy sources ( RES ) have strongly infiltrated sectors such as energy production and storage and cars .
#Text=Following the same logic , the shipping industry is already starting to change and implement technologies that reduce the environmental impact .
#Text=There are numerous research studies , experiments , and prototypes trying to implement almost every alternative technology and fuel in vessels .

#Text=Although it is not yet known which of these technologies will become dominant in the future , some of them have a strong statement of qualifications , and seem to be commonly accepted at present .
#Text=As far as the alternative fuels are concerned , biofuels , hydrogen , liquefied natural gas ( LNG ) , liquefied petroleum gas ( LPG ) , and methanol are among the most representative .
#Text=Ship engine manufacturers have started producing dual-fuel gas engines to allow the use of both natural gas and conventional fuels .
#Text=In terms of new technologies , batteries , fuel cells , and wind-assisted propulsion are being strongly considered .

#Text=The above-mentioned alternatives have different advantages and disadvantages , regardless of their short or long-run implementation , or just being part of the transitional stage of the evolving maritime industry .
#Text=A solution that suits all different types of vessels is probably impossible , as there are different capabilities and needs depending on teach type .
#Text=Nowadays , digitalization is rapidly growing and affects almost every industry .

#Text=In the naval sector , this impact is mostly through big data gathering and analysis , as well as real-time monitoring ( temperatures , emissions , etc. ) , and it brings along with automation , another growing field , fundamental changes such as autonomous shipping .
#Text=Taking a step back from the maritime industry , the energy sector in general is changing .
#Text=A big part of that change is attributed to electricity .
#Text=Research and development in fields such as battery capacity , durability , and customization push batteries ’ efficiency and price to be economically sustainable .
#Text=The automobile sector , mostly the car industry , is turning to electric vehicles and is responsible for the rapid development of these technologies .

#Text=Apart from the car industry , battery storage systems are also used for energy storage , ranging from simple photovoltaic installations ( PVs ) to high power output and capacity grid power storage .
#Text=The latter is the main reason for the present paper to focus on the capabilities of on-board photovoltaic installation and electric propulsion in the maritime industry .
